bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Middlesex County was formed in 1669 from Lancaster County.
An act passed by the Virginia legislature in 1803 required every free negro or mulatto to be registered and numbered in a book to be kept by the county clerk.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Middlesex County (Va.) Registers of Free Negroes and Mulattoes, 1800-1860, consists of two volumes. The first register covers the years 1800-1860 and is noted to be a transcription copied from Court Order Book 4 on January 1939. The second register convers the years 1827-1860. Both list the certificate number, age, name, color, stature, marks or scars, in what court or by whom the person was emancipated or whether the person was born free. Some clerks recorded additional information not required by law. There is no index to either volume.
